Need some clarification on one line in the starting genome file


From JNEA=
T xor:

 genomestart  1
 trait 1 0.1 0 0 0 0 0 0 0
 trait 2 0.2 0 0 0 0 0 0=
 0
 trait 3 0.3 0 0 0 0 0 0 0
 node 1 0 1 1
 node 2 0 1 1
 node 3 0 1 3
 no=
de 4 0 0 2
 gene 1 1 4 0.0 0 1 0 1
 gene 2 2 4 0.0 0 2 0 1
 gene 3 3 4 0.0 =
0 3 0 1
 genomeend 1

Looking at then gene lines and Cross referencing to K=
en's Neatdoc.ps
file, I make the first gene line as:


gene 1(link gene num=
ber) 1(from) 4(to) 0.0(weight) 0(recur flag? -
ignore) 1(innov number) 0(re=
dundant-ignore) 1(enable bit)

So far , so good, but when I look at another=
 example included with
JNEAT, for the parity example I get:

 genomestart  =
1
[...]
 gene 1 1 5 0.0 0 1     0 1
 gene 2 2 5 0.0 0 2     0 1
 gene 3 3 5=
 0.0 0 1(X1) 0 1
 gene 1 4 5 0.0 0 2(X2) 0 1
 genomeend 1


If the elements=
 marked X1 and X2 are starting innovations , I was
expecting '3' and '4' re=
spectively.

Please can someone clarify what that digit 3rd from the end me=
ans.

Thanks

Mike
